results.title: Soil
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Environment in crisis: problems of conservation”.
Shows what soil is and how it is formed - then illustrates the damaging effects of water and wind erosion. Another damaging depletion is the loss of nutrients in the soil. Illustrates with on the spot examples of how the U.S. conservation service in 1969 combated these projects that range from contour ploughing to land use planning.

results.title: Soil
results.creator_credit: Robin Wischusen, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
A plant must absorb essential nutrients from the soil and how a plant utilises essential nutrients and trace elements through the fixed, exchangeable and soluble nutrient pools is shown. The Nitrogen cycle is also explained. Roots absorb soil nutrients and depending on whether there is an excess or defecit of nitrogen, the soil is either acidic or alkaline. Soil texture is explained and the modern day use of hydroponics.

results.title: Soft hands = El Aydi el naema
results.creator_credit: General Company for Arabic Film Production and Mahmoud Zulfikar
results.brief_description: Romantic comedy starring Sabah, one of the Middle East’s most popular singers of the 50’s - 70’s. Following the Egyptian revolution, Prince Chawkat resides in his palace, desperately trying to avoid destitution. As he tries to manage his domestic finances, his debts mount, forcing his family to make ends meet. Prince Chawkat must learn to earn his own living rather than rely on his inheritance. His daughters Jihan and Myrva try to assist him, but his pride constantly intervenes. When the Prince falls in love with a young woman, played by Sabah, he finds that he must learn humility before he can earn her love. Prince Chawkat’s journey reflects the message of Nasser’s ‘New Egypt’, creating its own opportunities and relying on its own resources rather than looking towards Europe for economic harmony. The film promotes that a man can create a destiny that culminates in a harmonious marriage and family life, through study and hard work. Sabah sings Houb al Khatf (Secret Love) and Beh Fatha Ba.

results.title: Soft fruit
results.creator_credit: Helen Bowden, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Fox Searchlight Pictures and Christina Andreef
results.brief_description: An estranged and dysfunctional family are reunited when the matriarch of the clan is diagnosed with terminal cancer. Patsy is a stoic figure, keeping the family united, despite their fractured relationships. Patsy’s eldest daughter is a nurse, caring for her ailing mother; her other two daughters travel from Sydney and abroad with their respective children. Their brother, Bo, a biker with a history of drug abuse, is out of jail on special leave and has been disowned by his disapproving father. Vic, their father, is a disgruntled, violent figure who treats his children with disdain, whilst resenting their rallying around Patsy. The narrative is devoted to reconciliation between the disparate family members, in particular the relationship between father and son. In the spirit of black and bleak comedy, Christine Andreef’s debut feature is reminiscent of early Jane Campion work, in particular “Sweetie”; indeed “Soft fruit” has many of the hallmarks of that quirky Australian comedy. Contains scenes of great poignancy and humour, despite a certain unevenness in tenor. Cast includes Jeanie Drynan, Linal Haft, Russell Dykstra, Genevieve Lemon, Sacha Horler and Alicia Talbot.

results.title: Socialisation: the Dragon School, Oxford (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Argent, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personality and Learning”.
Looks at the process of socialisation in the Dragon school, an Oxford preparatory school of some 600 pupils, mostly boys, but with 24 girls. Illustrates some of the values of the school, different teaching approaches and the attitude explicit and implicit to social control.

results.title: Social sex attitudes in adolescence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adolescent Development”.
A document on the lives of fictitious Bob and Mary, focusing on the teen years. Here, lovestruck Mary is in her “hangout” stage when she always has a need to be “more sophisticated than she actually is.” Cross to Bob where his mother discovers a crude naughty drawing in his room and narrator Lorne Greene croons: “It became apparent that his interest in girls was getting to be more than casual.” But happily, Mary has maintained her virginal purity: “They knew that this time it was for keeps.” says Greene as the two gaze at a window display of refrigerators. But the couple refuse to succumb to temptation until they’re married.
